intro: Tofieldia pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf tofieldia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils in shaded to partially shaded environments, often found in forest understories. The plant produces delicate, grass-like leaves and small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses and sedges. Tofieldia pusilla is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
